markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Gacanagh (Passion Azata)](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2841)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Gancanaghs are lovers, revelers, and dashing duelists of [Elysium](/Planes.aspx?ID=40). Embodiments of free love, they eagerly throw themselves into courting targets for brief but earnest flings until their quicksilver passions change their desires. They serve [Cayden Cailean](/Deities.aspx?ID=280) as well as other bacchanalian deities and empyreal lords of Elysium who understand their desires for love and parties. Gancanaghs hate evil beings that profane the spirit of romance and passion, as such creatures (especially the demonic tempters known as [succubi](/Monsters.aspx?ID=98)) reinforce stigmas against open and free love. One can give no greater insult to a gancanagh than to mistake them for such a creature, and more than one hotheaded gancanagh has challenged a misinformed champion to a duel over such a slight. While they enjoy drinking and carousing, gancanaghs can't stand smoke. Nonetheless, many gancanaghs carry whimsical-looking smoking pipes because they think it makes them look dapper. They cherish their silver flutes, for they enjoy the beauty of flutes' music and its ability to sway the heart.

 The majority of gancanaghs present themselves as male, but the concept of gender to a creature like a gancanagh, who can change their shape freely, is much more fluid and open to interpretation than for many mortals. Gancanaghs enjoy using this flexibility to confront and test mortals' convictions when faced with fear or prejudice, but when encountering mortals who themselves are open-minded about sexuality or gender identity, they can become lifelong allies. For those who are persecuted for such reasons, gancanaghs are tireless defenders and eager supporters, quick to provide safety and to punish those who would attempt to impose narrower beliefs upon a world that deserves more diversity than it often gets. If possible, a gancanagh seeks to educate and redeem those who hold destructive beliefs or prejudices, resorting to combat only to defend themself or an endangered mortal, or when no other option seems tenable—yet even then, they fight with sadness.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Celestial](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 19

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Gancanagh.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 4">[Gancanagh](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2841)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Azata" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=543" />
<trait label="Celestial" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=551" />
<trait label="Holy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=517" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 32 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +11; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Diabolic](/Languages.aspx?ID=117), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115); [_truespeech_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +9, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +13, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +13, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +14, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +9, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +11

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +1

**Dex** +5

**Con** +3

**Int** +2

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +5
</row>

**Items**
[silver](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2860)[rapier](/Weapons.aspx?ID=391), [silver virtuoso flute](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2737)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 21 

**Fort** +9 

**Ref** +13 

**Will** +11 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 75

</row>

**Weaknesses**
[cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 5, [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521) 5

**Vulnerable to Smoke** A gancanagh's lungs can't tolerate smoke. They take a –2 circumstance penalty to saving throws against effects that create some form of smoke.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
silver rapier +13 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 1d6+7 piercing

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 23
- **1st**
[Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) (at will)
- **2nd**
[Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148), [Sure Footing](/Spells.aspx?ID=1708)
- **3rd**
[Heroism](/Spells.aspx?ID=149)
- **4th**
[Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315)
- **Constant (5th)**
[Truespeech](/Spells.aspx?ID=1728)

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127)) The gancanagh can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=628). This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage bonuses with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

**Invigorating Passion** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) The gancanagh embraces or kisses a willing creature adjacent to them, infusing that creature with their invigorating passion. For 10 minutes, the creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and 10 temporary Hit Points. After that time, the target becomes [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=73) for 10 minutes unless it succeeds at a DC 21 Fortitude save.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons//">Wandering Azatas</title>

While the idyllic realm of [Elysium](/Planes.aspx?ID=40) is the home plane of azatas, their overwhelming curiosity and natural wanderlust often lead them to travel far from this plane. On other planes, they can be found seeking to right wrongs, looking for entertainment, or merely exploring to see the sights. More than a few azatas, taken by a whimsical urge to spread their sometimes unwelcome jocosity, see it as their duty to tease uptight or humorless mortal creatures.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-368" />
name: Gancanagh
